wikipedia_page.main: Archibald Arnott (18 April 1772 – 1855) was a British Army surgeon best remembered as Napoleon's doctor on St. Helena, who was present at the Emperor's autopsy. In his retirement he returned to Ecclefechan, where he is buried.

response: * Archibald Arnott (1772–1855), British Army surgeon best remembered as Napoleon's last doctor on St. Helena

* Archibald Arnott (1772–1855), Napoleon's doctor on St Helena, was born in Ecclefechan on  18 April 1772 at Kirconnel Hall.  He returned to Ecclefechan in his retirement and he was also buried in the Ecclefechan churchyard.
